publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1947 Tommy Sheridan: National Missile Defence System—That the Parliament expresses its concern at the threat posed to Scotland by the National Missile Defence System of the United States; believes that this system will destabilise security, posing a specific threat to Scotland given the Trident nuclear base at Faslane, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government not to give British support to this scheme.

S1M-1947 Tommy Sheridan: National Missile Defence System—That the Parliament expresses its concern at the threat posed to Scotland by the National Missile Defence System of the United States; believes that this system will destabilise security, posing a specific threat to Scotland, given the Trident nuclear base at Faslane, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government not to give British support to this scheme.
S1M-1947 National Missile Defence System (lodged on 18 May 2001) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*

S1M-1947 Tommy Sheridan: National Missile Defence System—That the Parliament expresses its concern at the threat posed to Scotland by the National Missile Defence System of the United States; believes that this system will destabilise security, posing a specific threat to Scotland, given the Trident nuclear base at Faslane, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government not to give British support to this scheme. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram
S1M-1947 National Missile Defence System (lodged on 18 May 2001) Robin Harper*
S1M-1947 National Missile Defence System (lodged on 18 May 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Ms Sandra White*

S1M-1947 Tommy Sheridan: National Missile Defence System—That the Parliament expresses its concern at the threat posed to Scotland by the National Missile Defence System of the United States; believes that this system will destabilise security, posing a specific threat to Scotland, given the Trident nuclear base at Faslane, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government not to give British support to this scheme. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Robin Harper, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Ms Sandra White
S1M-1947 National Missile Defence System (lodged on 18 May 2001) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1947 National Missile Defence System (lodged on 18 May 2001) Christine Grahame*

S1M-1947 Tommy Sheridan: National Missile Defence System—That the Parliament expresses its concern at the threat posed to Scotland by the National Missile Defence System of the United States; believes that this system will destabilise security, posing a specific threat to Scotland, given the Trident nuclear base at Faslane, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government not to give British support to this scheme. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Robin Harper, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Ms Sandra White, Linda Fabiani, Christine Grahame
S1M-1947 National Missile Defence System (lodged on 18 May 2001) Mr John McAllion*

S1M-1947 Tommy Sheridan: National Missile Defence System—That the Parliament expresses its concern at the threat posed to Scotland by the National Missile Defence System of the United States; believes that this system will destabilise security, posing a specific threat to Scotland, given the Trident nuclear base at Faslane, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government not to give British support to this scheme. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Robin Harper, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Ms Sandra White, Linda Fabiani, Christine Grahame, Mr John McAllion
S1M-1947 National Missile Defence System (lodged on 18 May 2001) Shona Robison*

S1M-1947 Tommy Sheridan: National Missile Defence System—That the Parliament expresses its concern at the threat posed to Scotland by the National Missile Defence System of the United States; believes that this system will destabilise security, posing a specific threat to Scotland, given the Trident nuclear base at Faslane, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government not to give British support to this scheme. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Robin Harper, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Ms Sandra White, Linda Fabiani, Christine Grahame, Mr John McAllion, Shona Robison
